yacx

Class ArrayArg

  • java.lang.Object
    • yacx.JNIHandle
      • yacx.KernelArg
        • yacx.ArrayArg
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanArg, ByteArg, DoubleArg, FloatArg, HalfArg, IntArg, LongArg, PaddingArg, ShortArg

    public abstract class ArrayArg
extends KernelArg
    Class representing an array-argument for the kernel.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods

      Create an output-argument, which will be downloaded but not uploaded.

    • Method Detail

      • getSizeBytes

        protected abstract long getSizeBytes()
        Returns the size in bytes of each data-element from the array.
        Returns:
        size in bytes of each data-element

      • slice

        public abstract ArrayArg slice(int start,
                               int end)
        Slices the array.
        This creates a new ArrayArg corresponding to a new C-KernelArg-Object, but using the same memory for the array.
        If the content of this ArrayArg changed, the content of the created ArrayArg will be changed too. In the other direction as well.
        Parameters:
        start - index of the first element for the new array
        end - index of the last element for new array
        Returns:
        a new ArrayArg using the same memory for the array

      • createOutput

        protected static long createOutput(long sizeBytes)
        Create an output-argument, which will be downloaded but not uploaded.
        Parameters:
        sizeBytes - size of the output-argument in bytes
        Returns:
        a pointer to a new corresponding C-KernelArg-Object

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns the length of this array-argument.
        Returns:
        length of this array

      • isDownload

        public boolean isDownload()
        Returns whether the argument should be downloaded.
        Returns:
        true if this argument should be downloaded. false otherwise

      • setDownload

        public void setDownload(boolean download)
        Set whether the argument should be downloaded.
        Parameters:
        download - true if this argument should be downloaded. false otherwise

      • isUpload

        public boolean isUpload()
        Returns whether the argument should be uploaded.
        Returns:
        true if this argument should be uploaded. false otherwise

      • setUpload

        public void setUpload(boolean upload)
        Set whether the argument should be uploaded.
        Parameters:
        upload - true if this argument should be uploaded. false otherwise

      • slice

        protected long slice(long start,
                     long end)
        Create a Slice of this ArrayArg.
        Parameters:
        start - index of the first byte for the new array
        end - index of the last byte for new array
        Returns:
        a pointer to a new C-KernelArg-Object using the same memory for the array
